dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 4318 IH: Head Start for Our Future Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Castro of Texas (for himself, Mr. Ciscomani, Mr. Thompson of Mississippi, Mr. Baumgartner, Ms. Titus, Mr. Fitzpatrick, Ms. Velázquez, Ms. Tlaib, Ms. Leger Fernandez, Mrs. McIver, Mr. Moulton, Ms. Barragán, Mrs. Ramirez, Mr. Soto, Mr. Mullin, Mr. García of Illinois, Mr. Thanedar, Ms. Moore of Wisconsin, Ms. McBride, Mr. Subramanyam, and Ms. Bonamici) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and Workforce

form.official-title: To amend the Higher Education Act of 1965 to include child development and early learning as community services under the Federal work-study program.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Head Start for Our Future Act.

section.header: Child development and early learning community services
section.text: Section 441(c)(1) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1087–51(c)(1)) is amended by striking literacy training and inserting child development and early learning (including Head Start programs and Early Head Start programs carried out under the Head Start Act (42 U.S.C. 9831 et seq.)), literacy training.
